ahjzlAuNzHcFLzSRJHJowg.text: The food & service were great. However the plates is too small & the price is kind of expensive

hcbP9xxQ7apWPSg2CoV0RQ.text: Awesome food, service and ambience!!!  My favorite dishes were the duck & waffles, bacon wrapped dates & lamb chops.  Those dates were huge compared to other restaurants I have dined in. Lamb was perfectly seasoned with no hint of gaminess. Next time back, definitely try the foies gras & bone in ribeye.

JM2qXNGfbQ5urqU9RveTgA.text: I dined here the first week they were open and was really blown away by the food, service and bar. The space is so welcoming and cozy different than what i have seen in Las Vegas. The music they were playing felt like miami and was at the perfect volume. You can hold a conversation and also keep an upbeat vibe.   Ok so lets get right into this review and start with the bar. Finally a great Mojito in Las Vegas! Wow, the perfect amount of sweetness mint and lime. Im not sure what rum they were using that day but exceptional Bravo! Tobacco old fashioned was a fantastic twist on a classic and I loved it. I dont know any Bars in Vegas that have such a strong rum game. The drinks are really that good.    THE FOOD! wow!! From the moment the first bite hit my lips I knew I was in for an amazing experience. I think we started with a couple of Crudos as recommended by our server. I cant imagine a better way to start a meal than with fresh raw fish prepared many different ways. We had ceviches, a scallop on a piece of apple topped with truffle, beautiful taste and presentation. We had many hot plates. The menu is tapas style so its nice to be able to order different plates and really make your way down the menu.  The Duck and Waffles are just perfection, do me a favor and remove all the meat from the duck leg, put it on top of the waffle,   pour the maple syrup over it place the egg on top pop the yolk and eat. youll thank me later! Other plates we tried were: Foie Gras Bastilla, Bone Marrow, Sea Urchin Avocado Toast, Pig Ear Padthai and Fall Pumpkin and duck. Im sure there are others I am forgetting to mention..We were a group of 5 large guys so we got to try many of the plates and each one was great.   The service was on point. everyone was friendly, attentive, but the best thing for me was the staffs knowledge of the menu! any question I asked I got an immediate answer, no having to go and ask or check with the chef. The moment your glass needed water or your Drink was running low someone would fill it or ask if you needed another cocktail which was nice.   I have dined at many Vegas restaurants and at this moment Sugarcane is top of the list. The food is fantastic, well priced and the drinks are well made. The ambiance is relaxed and the decor is very inviting. Many Vegas restaurants can seem uninviting, intimidating and cold Sugarcane keeps it warm, inviting and tasty!  I had a smile on my face the whole time i was there. What more could you ask for? Try and save some room for dessert its great.   If your in Vegas go eat at Sugarcane You wont regret it.

aD0v21GO8Rtx8nT5LCPGlg.text: We decided to give this new restaurant a try one night and it didn't fail us. We came at a later hour for dinner so the place wasn't super busy. The staffs were professional and friendly. All the tapas were delicious, but slightly on the salty side for me and my boyfriend so we drank more water than we usually do. All the hot foods came out really hot and cold foods really cold which is a thumb up from me. A few of their tables are pretty low; if you are there to indulge their good foods and don't want your backs to feel tired at the end, ask for regular height tables.

ovhKolUKCMPukQjy79qIDQ.text: Been here for dinner and brunch. Both are amazing!   My faves for brunch are the waffles and oxtail Benedict. For dinner, I love the salmon poke, burrata salad, roasted chicken. The atmosphere is fun and service is always great.

NPu_kVA9kxfgjfItOyyaEg.text: This is my first yelp review, but felt it needed to be done. Came in for brunch after reading reviews and couldn't have been more disappointed. The menu looked great and the hostess was happy to seat us. Our waitress was sweet. All down hill from there. 1) It took really long to get our food--I mean really long. We ordered the beignets when we ordered our drinks and then ordered our breakfasts when the drinks were delivered. The beignets were slow but we were chill about it. Our breakfasts took so long we considered leaving. I wish we had. 2) None of us thought our breakfast was good. The bacon was so hard it was ridiculous--not crispy but hard. Eggs were overcooked. Food was not hot, just barely warm. "Specialty dishes" were just okay. The food temp didn't help. We all thought it probably sat under warmers for a while. Getting the check and paying was another frustratingly long process. And really overpriced for what we had (and we have no problem spending $ on food/drinks). We still tipped 20% because our waitress was nice and I spent a lot of years in the business, but we would never go back.

SR7EqZcvKSyJND1TQIzUwg.text: Was totally unimpressed. Went in for a lunch meeting during the CES show and waited at the table over an hour just to put in our our order.  The pork chops I ordered were only okay and priced too high. I will avoid in future years.

O25TqHJW3FRaaEaSdyC1rA.text: Lots to chose from in Vegas these days when it comes to dining.  Well, look no further.  Ate there last night, busy Monday night, and the experience was fantastic.  The wait staff are all super attentive, friendly, and super knowledgeable.  Devorah, the manager quickly came to my rescue with a desperately needed pen and paper (you saved me!) For two, we shared hamachi crudo, bacon wrapped dates, pig ear pad thai, Thai shortribs and the lamb chops.  Every dish was excellent, well flavored, and DIFFERENT (some times this sort of mixed item menu suffers from sweet soy flavors on just about everything).  Each dish was tastier than the next and portions were decent size, not small.  In terms of cocktails,   I ordered the rum Old Fashioned from the menu which was excellent.  Upon finishing our waiter recommended the smoked orange peel Rum Manhattan which was not on the menu- smoky and unique.  Maybe there is a whole "secret" cocktail menu? Hmmm.. will definitely inquire on my next trip to Vegas and will CERTAINLY return to Sugarcane.  Last but definitely not least, I should also mention that this restaurant is well priced for Vegas and the quality of the experience.

ZtIGcCDyFHfMvLOW93EF6Q.text: This spot was very highly recommend to us by a good local friend of ours so we decided to try it and it definitely lived up to the recommendation. It is a tapas sharing concept and we tried a number of the dishes on the menu. They were all terrific but the stars of menu where the pig ear Pad Thai and the Korean style beef short ribs. The grilled dishes are expertly cooked on a wood fired open grille which just takes things to another level. Between the char from the wood fired grille, the sauce and the chilies the short ribs were out of this world. For dessert we had the Torrejas which was delicious, I especially liked the cinnamon ice cream that accompanies it. The restaurant is well put together and has a great vibe. Their music mix was terrific and just added to an already good energy this place has. To round out a totally amazing experience the service was outstanding! We have dined at more expensive and lavish restaurants and not had this level of service! Everyone from our server Kennith to the manager to the support staff were attentive and worked seamlessly. Fortunately they are open till 2am so the next evening after our bar hoping we ended up here at 1am to have our two favorite dishes we craved. What a great way to close out the night.

29o-weFAQzf6azJStlEq7A.text: BITCHEN Drinks~  sat at the bar after a concert thinking it was too late to eat.  Everything was delicious and the staff could not have been kinder.  We started out with one plate but could not stop Octopus is a must.

BJcGgb0Pfc2kWozyiYKH2Q.text: Seriously what a surprisingly amazing meal. We are foodies. We did Le Cirque...not bad. But Basil Quencher and Spice of Love libations are AMAZING! Then, the kampachi ceviche, sea scallops were really good. Then, we get the veal cheek Bone Marrow. Omg holy shit!!!  Seriously one of best things I ever ate!

Z_MMuxMAt8V73_iDzLd0WA.text: First time here so might give it another shot but I must say service was to be desired. I made a reservation with open table which was fine but they have two entrances and there's only one hostess and if you come in the wrong entrance like I did she's easy to miss so we had to seats ourselves. Not a big deal really but just an observation. We had the sliders and collapse the rules and smash potatoes they were OK nothing special just a little something to pass some time. They brought us the wrong drinks and when it was  time for the check he brought me one receipt with an amount of $56 and then after charging it ithe second receipt for 86$. And then he tells me oh it's just an authorization to be charged but of course being the skeptic that I am I checked my account and of course they charge me twice

GChICIAW1dxMHJq-V5Zcrg.text: This place was delicious. Truly inspired menu with such great flavors. Would recommend to anyone looking for great food around the Venetian.

jUEiQzU7Lbz78VKpdRrCyw.text: Amazing food. We ordered so many things. From skirt steak. The Korean ribs. Salad. Avocado toast! Let's not even talk about the dessert. Amazing. Everything was incredible. The service was impeccable. I will def be back

G6h0h78QtQf3mTJ_XVO3Aw.text: Everything was amazing. We hesitated to go in because it wasn't very crowded; however, were glad we did. The fat boy hash and pancakes were so flavorful and unique. The burger and fries, mushrooms, smashed potatoes and steak were also very good.

CM0_AJyHloImrY0NpT1_Yg.text: Sugarcane is delicious.  Just the right vibe of casual and cool.  The food ( especially the Brussel sprouts and pig ear pad thai ).  Everything was tasty and unique.  Service was exceptional.  Ask for Cruz, he's the guy.

FoXME_vpqL_6GF_FueK0IA.text: Located on the casino floor of the Venetian, Sugarcane is a really great small plates restaurant.  We came mostly for the desserts but the food was quite good as well.  Would recommend the bacon wrapped dates.  The cauliflower soup was ok but preferred the bone marrow and the eggplant more.  The desserts were really amazing.  Had the sesame cake and the Nutella sundae.  The service was fast and friendly.  The only compliant is the price for the amount of food, which is expected from a small plates restaurant on the Strip.  The dessert is probably the best for the price.  Be prepared to spend a lot if you are hungry.

MMXmlPqTiISYGG4i4ySfqQ.text: The space itself is nice.  Modern design with a touch of Caribbean thrown in.  Nice plantation shutters.  The food and service were average.  Our waiter was pleasant but didn't really seem to know the menu.  A couple of plates we ordered never made it to the table.  We asked about the portion size on a couple of dishes and he got them wrong.  Standouts on the food were the sweet corn with the chipotle mayo, the sweet potato with maple soy and walnuts and the Korean fried chicken.  Cauliflower soup was blah, the beef sliders are over priced at $8 an individual slider, as is the shrimp cocktail, which at $9 a piece were bland and served with 2 uninspired sauces.  For a restaurant with a Caribbean flair the specialty cocktail list was boring. They do however have an extensive rum list for people who are a fan of rum.

hYVA6TYM-JdRhpqODhv7Lw.text: This place is amazing, really happy it was open late. Everything we ordered was pretty great, but one thing that stood out was the bone marrow. It's just incredible, just try it. The veal cheek its paired with makes the overall experience mind blowing.

7lynNhW9_-6bGC-4VKCcHg.text: Danny and J.R. are a credit to this establishment. Happy hour oysters are a deal. Bacon wrapped dates are fantastic. Had a ceviche too, all were quite good but bar staff made it. Kudos!

uqEfdt2xLH_bLtfYIR1BQg.text: We came to Sugar Cane the night we arrived for late night happy hour. Mari prepared us their Strawberry Balsamic drink  and a Froze.  The drinks were delicious. We ordered oysters and goat cheese croquettes that were perfect for the hungry traveler but light enough for the exhausted after a 6 hour flight. We loved it so much that we came back again. Mari remember us and the drinks we had ordered two nights prior. The drinks were even better this time after our exhaustion wore out. Don't miss Sugar Cane in Vegas!

3kpMqFzDhakJ_QiuOZvpJQ.text: Dropped in for quick lunch, didn't expect much. Ordered duck confit and waffle and the salmon poke and sweet corn. Turned out the food are very well prepared with totally unexpected amount of finest and care invested. A pleasant surprise. Great value for money.

qUXBvP9Bv52QUNUARB6bgg.text: Awesome food , amazing chef, excellent service . We loved the ambience . Duck and waffle , bacon wrapped dates , octopus , sea bass , scallop ,Koba fish everything tastes so good . Definitely the best restaurant we want too . Highly recommend it . Josh took care of us and suggested many dishes that were amazing and even the manager was nice and made sure we enjoyed our meal.

dh0tokgK_stLAWtsXHWKKw.text: Best happy hour in Palazzo Casino. The happy hour drinks and food are great. Mari, the bartender, is the best! Her happy attitude is like icing on the cake! She makes everything even better! Be sure to sit in her area when visit!

9qsa02wkTIt5E7_sgXlE3g.text: This place was extremely pleasing.  Definitely Worth my time, to provide feed back of my visit. My husband and I sat at the bar for brunch on Saturday, Nov. 4, 2017. I hate to say, I forgot our waiters name, he was awesome.  He wears a perfect Mohawk.  The waiter gave unsurpassed customer service.  He provided a plethora of information of the city. Although my husband and I have been to Sin city many times, with no two times ever being the same, he provided even more suggestions and information of activity's and sights. He also knew the menu like the back of his hand. I also listened to him interact with guest around me.  My husband had the Oxtails with a poached egg.  The meat was very well seasoned and tender. He became a Fan.  I experienced the simple waffles and fresh fruit, with a side, over medium egg. There was nothing simple about the perfectly fresh fruit that covered my delectable waffles. I would tell anyone to go by and enjoy the experience.

GHsVhU2Ug_kzzCuhtraNPA.text: I recently had a three course meal at this restaurant and it did not disappoint. Their offering is very avant-garde and the flavours will leave you thinking of this dinning experience for days.

rcRNiKJWUr9_qeu1VcA-Bw.text: Have an open mind & wallet!  And ask for Russel (waiter) wish every restaurant had a Russel!

6hJalHH7GwNtoASbUgZc0Q.text: Went for happy hour, oysters are $1.50 and select drinks are $6-$8. Also had the bacon wrapped dates those were on the dry side. :-/ i also Wasn't a fan of the tobacco old fashioned only because the anise flavor was overpowering like licorice :-/ so if you do like that flavor go for it. The basalmic strawberry was good and also not on happy hour i forgot what it was called but it's grey goose with mango and passion fruit puree i liked that a lot.

YArJfDihqKA3JS-B8nobJw.text: We had an excellent meal at Sugarcane!Highly recommend the brussel sprouts! They were done to perfection. The bacon wrapped dates are something special as well. Don't forget dessert!! The torrejas will blow your mind!! Great service great food. Highly recommend!

Big5OJdY3qQm2notwOct-Q.text: Quality was above-average here the food was fantastic tasting and had what I thought was a pretty original menu all this being said it's a small menu place so don't go there if you're really hungry it will only tease you to get a full meal out of this place you have to order three of everything and it's kind of pricey one of the plates we had was the lamb shanks which were incredible however $36 appetizer is a little steep we had three of us at the table and we all walked away hungary.

DkZrF85M_cXaaUOK1I2xcw.text: I had an amazing experience my first time in sugarcane!  The host Victoria who graciously welcomed me with a big smile and positive attitude suggested I try the kinilaw Kampachi, goat cheese croquettes, and ribs. Well let me just say I'll be back again because those dishes were absolutely DELICIOUS and my server Aldana was well versed on the menu having a detailed answer for every question I threw her way.   ** I will add when you read the menu you should go in with an open mind and pick one thing you might not normally go for because it'll pleasantly surprise you!   Great service all around thank you for a great lunch!

ZH99K6T23EhWUPCPLpOJlg.text: OMG, the waffles. We had breakfast. Just breakfast. Merely breakfast but it came from heaven.  I had waffles with cream and berries whilst the gorilla,er ah, hubby had an omelet. This hippo, um, woman, was a happy camper. The waffles were perfectly cooked and the cream delicious. Hubby loved his meal as well. We left completely full but not overstuffed. Might have been from that additional order of beigna, benyay, bei --- french pastries.Insert Homer Simpson slobber here - the waffles!

iq1FQqUZBsHxBR8UUT6gRA.text: I had an absolutely incredible first-time experience here.  All the other restaurants were packed; and while busy, Sugarcane had plenty of room to accommodate. They had a full staff on duty that was well trained, and worked collectively as a team to get things done.  Our party noticed it because it because our wait time wasn't long at all, as opposed to the other restaurants. I was skeptical of the menu, because upon reading its diverse selections ,it seemed too good to be True. I was pleasantly surprised as the food was delicious, and everyone in party adored their food as well! The customer service experience was impeccable, and Devorah went out of her way to make us feel welcomed and thoroughly accommodated. I truly enjoyed my birthday experience here, I give it 10's across the board, and I plan to go back very soon.

bsVbnXbUqvAhNOMR19-p1w.text: Danny the bartender is fantastic!  Order his "Lower East Side" made with Tulamore Dew, dry vermouth and grapefruit bitters. Fantastic!!!!  The atmosphere is very comfortable. Background noise does not interfere with intimate conversations. They currently have 160 different rums and soon to add 50 more!  They also have a special rum at $1500 per shot!  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ipIF430eJ_IaW3o16ELb9A.text: The oysters here are fabulous and shucked beautifully! Can't beat the happy hour price. I have been here on several trips to Vegas and the service is always fantastic. Everything I tried was amazing, goat cheese croquettes, Japanese eggplant, sweet potatoes, tartares, Brussels sprouts. I highly recommend this place!

I82zlfc8YQN-CesmjXao_A.text: Everything was amazing. Service, ambiance and flavors within the cuisine. I'm not usually a duck person but the duck and waffles was my favorite. We got 8 different shared plates too!

LuSgwWInzzuysdzOH8Zo8g.text: My visits to Sugarcane at its current location at the Venetian were only a few days after it opened. The sense of disorientation evident with most of the staff during my time here may be due to this little incidental. That being said, the bartenders I interacted with had a good attitude in general and avoided getting flustered easily, as far as I could tell. And if one is looking for fine rum cocktails and is nearby, this place is surely a solid choice. The Tobacco rum Old-Fashioned is simple in its classic presentation yet original enough to stand out of the crowd. It's my favorite of what I had here. The Hemingway had a fine presentation indeed, but was a bit too tart IMO. And the Rum n Bramble and the Beet Mojito were decent choices; yet they seemed a tad too similar in taste to each other. Still, the atmosphere here was inviting during my stay; and the rum cocktails were this place's redeeming quality in the end.

6VHiTJFuDma_fmgZtmYN3g.text: Fantastic service! The hostess originally sat us next to the bar. There was a group of three people right next to our table. She kindly asked them to move down away from our table. When she noticed that they didn't move after a few minutes, she relocated us to a different table. She said "I wouldn't want people talking over my table either". Our server was wonderful too. After we placed our food order, she informed us the raw bar was backed up. The manager came over later and brought over some free apps to hold us over. The food was excellent as well!

osP4uCjONY8lakz3Bs3_0w.text: Awesome service at the bar! Great happy hour prices and all the food I had was very good. I had the salmon poke, croquettes and oysters. I would visit here again for happy hour.

SbS_uPn64IyZKPbR0mDceA.text: Brunch here was very good! Enjoyed bottomless mimosas for $25 & ordered the beignets to start. They were delicious & had a chocolate sauce to dip in that was so yummy! I ordered the Fat Boy Hash and my husband ordered Huevos Rancheros. Both dishes were very good & full of flavor. Good atmosphere, brunch was pretty reasonably priced, and service was great.

tC5CVlAT2bLgQl-6fqKdqg.text: Went there with a group of 16 girls for a bachelorette party, we were able to reserve on a Saturday night for that much people without any problem! The place looks stunning with a view of the kitchen from the dinning area.  They were really courteous and understanding with the amount of people there. They had specialty fruity drinks, but no one was really impressed with them. We split the group in 2 tables and ordered food family style for each table. Our table took a plate each to share and I think we could have ordered a few more plates to complete the meal as I was left not fully satisfied after the meal, but still feeling full (weird, I know).   The goat cheese croquettes were good (basically small fondue parmesan if you are french like me) and everything with meat in it was cooked perfectly with a lot of flavor. Most of the vegetable dishes were also pretty good, I pretty much can't recall any average plate. My friend is a very picky oyster eater and she was really impressed with their quality. We also tried the Pig Ear Pad Thai and it was really good, basically tasted like chips but better.  Overall, family style food are my favorite types of restaurant and this is a good one. Most of the plates were delicious and I would go there again.

L1QmPFMUemQa9vUSj4KOOw.text: I had the ox tail Benedict.  Delicious! Made for a good breakfast. Served on a long slice of bread. The spot is nice but typical for Vegas restaurant. Nothing too dazzling there. Service was friendly but a bit sluggish considering it wasn't very busy. All-in-all it was about par.

-LDBLfUBlyzrYNEHi0ImFg.text: We were seated right away but I was about to leave because we waited a good 10 or 15 minutes without even water and the place was mostly empty with lots of service individuals chit chatting by the bar.  My husband finally got manager's attention who immediately took our order and threw in several freebies.  Now the food itself was uniquely prepared, fresh and full of flavor.  Not all the dishes were favorites but they were all memorable.  Brussel sprouts was artfully prepared with ponzu topped with citrus.  Bacon wrapped dates stuffed with sausage was too chewy and sweet but I appreciate the attempt.   Goat cheese croquettes were simple & delightful.  The wagyu carpaccio was disappointing as they topped it with too much sauce and greens to taste the meat.  Pig Ear Pad Thai was sweet crunchy bits on top of perfectly pickled papaya salad.

7kHo4bnj4hYzhD7rUOVnog.text: Like the small plate concept, but the dishes were not that great. We had 10 different plates for four people. Enough food, but nothing worth ordering twice.

aLEb19HZU9GQcLO6BHNu4Q.text: The food is so inconsistent here. Been here 3 times and wouldn't go again. There are way better options at Venetian/Palazzo

HS1vaUgNo-2usRuYKCH-lQ.text: Amazing food!, amazing staff and service. Every time I'm here we have a wonderful time.Ron, Marie, Hayley and James we're just wonderful! I cannot wait to come here again! :)

photos.caption: Photo of SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. When in Vegas #usa

3eJtBo8FfMVJGo1Lp3kl4A.text: I was searching for restaurants/bars in Vegas that are known for their mixologists on Yelp and this place came up. I was surprised how small their beverage menu was. The Spice of Love drink was tasty but didn't blow me away.   The dishes were just ok. The scallop dish on the crudo menu was the only dish I enjoyed. It was an explosion of flavors in my mouth. Burrata salad and cauliflower soup were my least favorite dishes.   Our server was excellent. He was very friendly, explained the entire menu and recommended dishes.   I made a reservation on Open Table and received a call from the restaurant the morning of confirming my reservation. I called right back and spoke to the hostess to confirm. When my husband and I arrived, the hostess said we didn't have a reservation. I told her someone called me to confirm and she seemed clueless. She sat us anyways. Side note - you get dinged on open table and they will cancel your account if you miss more than 3 reservations.   This looks like a good place to pop into if you don't have reservations and just want a few appetizers.

0jDrdq0rVo1XOz1i5sggJA.text: The food was incredible! Everything else about our experience at Sugarcane was incredibly horrible. Our food all came out at different times, to the point were I was already done with my food by the time my fiance's came. The food was also "auctioned" off. Shouldn't the server know who ordered what instead of standing at one end of the table and yelling to see who had the lamb? My friend ordered a drink at the beginning of the meal and never received it. To put a cherry on top of the horrible Sundae, we found out that we "couldn't" split our 11 person tab. This is 2018... how can you not be able to split a tab? This restaurant was completely ridiculous and the hugest joke I've ever been too.

inaMDJysD4YStJ83KfaFfQ.text: This review is based only on the dessert. We ordered the Torrejas and it was AMAZING!! I highly recommend it!!

Photo of SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Torrejas

GzsNy-udms5zGbK6YPVviQ.text: One of the many great restaurants you can find in Vegas and conveniently located at the Venetian if you're staying there. It's hard to get a table depending on the time of the day and if you don't have a reservation. Luckily my colleagues and I were able to get seated immediately for a group of 7 and the hostesses were more than helpful to accommodate for the large party.   This place serve tappas (small plates) so its meant to be shared with others. Foods that we ordered were: Hamachi Crudo, pig ear pad thai, duck waffle confit, foi gras fried rice, chicken lettuce wraps, bone marrow, angus sliders, japanese eggplant, and spanish octopus.   The Foi gras fried rice, pig ear pad thai and the hamachi were my favorites by far. The pig ear is nice and crunchy, and you just want to keep eating it cause of those sweet and sour notes. The hamachi was really fresh. The foi gras fried rice smelled savory and the buttery fat of the foi gras made the rice taste really nice. Everything else was really nice too but to sum it up, everything here is pretty solid. You will def have a good time here

JJRW-9RR7Gv4kWFQK7u1FA.text: Best place we've been so far on this trip to Vegas- everything 5 stars- Blue fin poke- buh-bam! Goat cheese croquettes- ka-frickin-boom!  Garden bliss drink with thyme, pepper, and gin/ kapow!  And my beet mojito- top o' the evening, jack.  Damn.  Love this place.

3nPHC4xilpsGuR9vPs3iWw.text: Plain jane dressed in urban outfitters, slightly above average flavors with nicer packaging.  Food: The recommended octopus skewer tasted like pizza-pockets-flavored rubber on a stick.  Misc: Awkwardly low cushioned seats makes you feel like a toddler dining at the grownup's table unless you have an abnormally long torso.

W0LLc9W2dwAyq4pIOVbWnw.text: Not a bad place by any means but the cost is a little too high for what u get. The wagyu carpaccio was a mess, overwhelmed by piles of nonsense on top of it. The lobster rolls were meh n youd prob get a better roll at the lobster place in the food court in the canals. The ribs were tasy, just overpriced. The drinks were the only thing that stood out as really good. Most everything was mediocre quality at much more expensive rates. For the money, do yourself a favor and walk a few hundred feet down and go to delmonicos for the real deal.

0aTWteAilbAnj6D9OGAL_w.text: Soooo we met uncle g and Ron and they're great bartenders. Come during happy hour for the amazing pig ear pad Thai!!!!!! Sooooo good. They also have a delicious yuzu shot. Oh so good.

photos.caption: Photo of SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wmh3ppnPXyxhPL7RL5vM8Q.text: Did we stop by here on an off night? Why are the reviews so positive?  We ordered a bunch of items on the menu, ranging from the brussel sprouts, to octupus skewer, squid, bone marrow, bluefin tuna ceviche, hamachi crudo, beet salad, and a few more in which I don't remember. The only item we liked was the hamachi crudo. Everything else tasted way off. All of the protein dishes were bad due to the quality of meat. The brussel sprouts were burnt and tasted bitter. Over all for the price and the location, I can't imagine coming back here again.  The service was nice though. So was the decor.

FKfJgM8M0tD6jE_KM1EemQ.text: Good, but the portions are way too small... Especially for Vegas after a night of drinking and being up late. Are usually want a full brunch when I'm in Vegas, it did not deliver. But I will say it was delicious, but too pricey for what they offer.

LuNuxh17iCF0-hSJiCQv5w.text: This is definitely a place to bring family and friends to enjoy a light meal before or after any event.  The setting is relaxed and the atmosphere is warm and  inviting. The  food is made to order so it may have just a little bit of wait time but nothing good comes cheap or fast !  Raquel our waitress did an excellent job of explaining everything we were ordering and gave spot on recommendations that my family might enjoy.  This adventure we decided to devour :  Hokkaido Scallops - Delicious , light and although I was hoping for a little bit more Scallop flavor  to come through the pairing of all the items complimented the overall taste Blue Fin Tuna Tartare-Very nice mild flavor and buttery tuna that felt like it just melted in your mouth Salmon Poke- Good , cost effective but I should have stuck with all the signature dishes.  I would have to say if you are bringing a date and want to impress them with the restaurant environment without breaking the bank, this is what to order.  Familiar and inexpensive with great taste. Harissa beets- I must admit I did not try it only so that I could get the feedback from my family. Let's just say that if anyones hand was close by the dish it would have been taken right off.  Days later and still the beets were a conversation piece.  YUP.. Beets.. Goat Cheese Croquettes-  I would also recommend this one as a Date night not break the bank dish.  Great sweet and savory pairing with a  light crunch.   Sea Urchin and Avocado toast -  LOL I knew it was gonna be good just from reading the title of the item on the menu.  How can you go wrong with the buttery flavor of Sea Urchin and the smooth silky flavors of the avocado? It was a match made in heaven !  All the flavors came through like polite guests at a dinner party.  Ahhh.. a taste of Sea Urchin, slightly nutty and buttery then it's guest avocado shows up LOL.. ok ok.. getting off track.. This dish was pretty damn good and I would.. let me rephrase.. I WILL order it again the next time I come. Foie gras bastilla-  Holy cow, you hear about this kinda stuff on the food channel but never really thought it would appeal to me as something I might crave.   Close your eyes and imagine.. light , crispy, delicate .. smooth creamy flavors as soon as you bite and that will be the Foie gras bastilla.   In layman's terms, this stuff be like CRACK !  Very addicting and I should have ordered more.  Here's a tip.. If you get this dish make sure to eat it WITH the edible flowers.  whoahhh..  In essence , you come to this place to enjoy the atmosphere, great taste and excellent employees who in my opinion were very attentive, professional and knowledgable.  If you stumble upon this GREAT establishment and think you can order an 0.89 Happy meal you are sorely mistaken.  This is NOT a buffet, this is NOT Mcdonalds, you are paying for an experience with professionals who treat their food like art.  Oh.. and although they have a large plate area of the menu this is a Tapas(small plate for sharing) restaurant.  Try to do a little research before going to a restaurant. It would be like me going into an Indian restaurant and being mad that they didn't have burgers on the menu then complaining on yelp about it.  Silly huh.. yep..

kbhf9nZssOXMKWsIMY2RhA.text: My co-workers and I went to try this place out and it was good but didn't wow me. Definitely tried some things off their menu that I normally would never order that I actually enjoyed. The decor made the restaurant feel kinda casual but the pricing on the menu is more business casual /upscale. I would say 2-4 tapas plates per person with the bill average about $50 person (with a cocktail) It's a but loud as well with music playing but it's actually great music we found ourselves dancing and singing along a few times!   Drinks: -Spice of Love 3/5  -Strawberry Balsamic 4/5 -Old Fashioned 1/5  Food: -Goat cheese croquettes 3/5 (not a fan of goat cheese personally but everyone else really enjoyed it) -Bacon wrapped dates 5/5 (don't really like dates but it was bacon wrapped, thick cut bacon and it was crispy, and stuffed with sausage. It was delicious with that salty sweet combination.) -Brussels sprouts 4/5 (made with an orange glaze/soy sauce)  -Pig ear pad thai 2/5 (never had ear pigs it was good but only have it a 2 because I was not a fan of the pad thai sauce) -Hokkaido Scallops 3/5 (3/5 per my co-workers) I don't eat seafood  -Harissa beets 1/5 I don't like beets but tried the dish. Nope still don't like beets...beets themselves always taste to earthy for me...like dirt. Nothing against this dish, just do not like beets. My co-workers that like beets said it would be 4/5.  -Duck and Waffle 4/5 This was a nice twist on chicken and waffles. Nice crispy leg/thigh of the duck w/ a buttery waffle and sunny side egg on top. Oh and the maple syrup...out of this world! I'd put that on everything!  -Chicken thighs 4/5 Very tasty. Their take on lettuce wraps. The seasoning on the chicken with yummy. I just wish you get more but I guess that's why it's tapas style.  -Skirt steak 4/5 The steak was tender and grilled well. The chimichurri sauce made the dish.  -Sweet Corn 5/5 This was my 2nd favorite dish. Sweet corn, full of flavor, and just a hint of spice.  -Torrejas 5/5 This was AMAZING! "Bread pudding" chunks with caramelized apples in a honey butter maple sauce with a cinnamon ice cream on the side...oh boy...I'd go back there just for this dessert!

QGZKUAOmg8lcBcnqzDY8jQ.text: Meh, I've had much better. There are a ton of restaurants in Vegas in this price option with a much higher quality of food. The service, decor, and menu were all good. I'll go through our orders now:  Pig ear Pad Thai- Solid dish, the flavors were nice and this had a nice blend of sweetness from the papaya salad.   Thai Style Pork Ribs- The best dish we had- very flavorful and tender. Would get this again for sure.  Spanish Octopus- It could have used a bit more char. Decent flavor but I've had much better.  Yellowtail Collar- I wasn't a fan of this; not necessarily because of the taste, but more due to the portion sizing and it was slightly overcooked.  Beef short ribs (Korean style)- Go to any Korean BBQ place and these are pretty much the exact same. These weren't different than anything I have had before. This did have the best value at this restaurant, though.   All in all, I've had much better. I like the concept a lot (small plates/slightly upscale), but the flavors weren't there and I thought that none of these dishes really stood out in any way, shape, or form. Sushi Samba in the Venetian is superior for similar prices.

eaOALz07Fp5MvTs3QxWfkQ.text: We liked it enough to go twice! The raw bar is pretty good, albeit the dishes are tiny for the cost. We liked the breakfast and the dinner menu. Service was consistently good.

TyT3d25wK68ZYa4qgQ0KHw.text: The poke bowl was delicious! The sauces went perfectly with the salmon and the rice was well done.   Service here left something to be desired - it was on the slow side although there appeared to be adequate staff and openings throughout the restaurant. It was a bigger deal than it should have been to get a check split between 4 people. Our waitress told us she had to get a manager's approval.   Bathrooms are located outside the restaurant in the general hotel area.

ii0IsGMDfNgVvMIYcLt4Rw.text: Luis and kiana are the Best. We had a great experience and they made it better.   Luis was taking empty plates away and giving refills! There is nothing worse that an empty cup! He made sure he refilled us before they went empty.   Kiana was very present. She suggested a few dishes and they were delish.   What ever you do try the edamame. You will not regret it. It was hi Walt the best. I could of ate it all nite!   Good place to get something quick. The fool was very flavorful and light.

6DDcBzGTkVDesDKUG1-QnA.text: All of my Yelp friends who have been to SUGARCANE Raw Bar and Grill had given them 5 stars and I COMPLETELY AGREE!!   SUGARCANE Raw Bar and Grill is located in Restaurant Row between Venetian and Palazzo, closer to the Venetian. I would recommend getting a reservation no matter what time you come here because we came before lunch time on a Tuesday and there were no tables available. Luckily there were seats available at the bar.   The menu here is made to be shared. From the Crudos section, we had the Hamachi Crudo ($17). From the Hot Kitchen section, we had the Bacon Wrapped Dates ($17) and the Bone Marrow ($18). From the Open Fire Grill section, we had the Spanish Octopus ($18).   Hamachi Crudo - Thin slices of Hamachi with serrano onion relish, sea asparagus and Japanese chili lime and soy sauce. The Hamachi was very fresh and was a nice raw touch to complement the rest of our order.   Bacon Wrapped Dates - Huge juicy bacon wrapped dates compared to the ones that I have seen at other tapas places. It came with some fresh greens on top and a smear of an aged Spanish cheese.   Bone Marrow - This order of Bone Marrow was larger than what we imagined. The large bone marrow was topped with sweet braised cheek and 4 large slices of bread. I usually see bone marrow as a not-so-filling item since it it usually served with only bone marrow and small crostinis, but this order could easily be a full meal. It was incredible rich and fatty, so if you get this item, I recommend some other acidic or fresh items to complement your meal.   Spanish Octopus - This is probably the item that I liked the least by compare. I just feel like it wasn't good value. This was basically one octopus tentacle grilled and topped with red chili sauce.   I highly recommend SUGARCANE Raw Bar and Grill!! I admit it was well on the pricey side, but the quality and experience was definitely worth it for me.

TMDRYjUIPvL5_F85HSkWHg.text: We had just left a concert at the Venetian Theatre and spotted this restaurant on the way out.  We wanted something light since it was late in the evening.    Its not a large space and is just of the beaten path of the other Canal Shoppes, but looked inviting with a well stocked bar and well presented raw bar.  The specialty cocktails looked great and priced in line with other strip venues.  I stuck with the house Manhattan which did not disappoint.  I really wanted the oysters but at $55/dozen looked for other options.  We started with the bone marrow and empanadas.  The bone marrow was tender and juicy since they incorporated cheek into the mix.  The empanadas were crisp and flavorful.  Before going on, a huge Shout out to our server Adrian, we has very attentive and all his suggestions were right on point.  We continued with the Skirt steak and Chimichurri which was cooked to our liking and again seasoned well.  We closed with the Thai Crab Cakes.  The Crab Cakes were more crab than filler which is always a plus.  The Thai sauce was good, a bit sweet for my taste, but a good accompaniment.  My only gripe is that they had a DJ, which was so odd because its NOT a huge bar, and there is no dance floor.  The music was LOUD, so if were not for the great food and service we would have left.  If you want good food and service priced right then Sugarcane is worth a visit, but if the DJ is in the house and you are not ready to have to yell at your guests, find something else more suitable.   Food and Service rate a 5, but the DJ and Loud music knock it down a couple of notches.

ps7RKSn9uQvxKJ55oVvo7w.text: Ok selection at the Venetian. Created to look like a Caribbean restaurant with plentiful selection of  Rum, serving tapas.  Service was ok, portions were small to minuscule, but again it was not overly pricey!   Perhaps food is a side business to drinking!

QGEvCM3Mmw2Z7wTNKXtbPg.text: We had dinner here twice during a recent business trip. In general, SUGARCANE does a good job with seafood in various forms, along with other tapas-like presentations -- other highlights were the Brussels sprouts and the skirt steak with chimichurri sauce. We enjoyed a seafood tower as well, which was a fun diversion, if not particularly noteworthy.   Prices are in line with the Strip, but certainly not a great value compared with similar restaurants in other cities. SUGARCANE is not a bad choice, but not a showstopper either.

u8Jrfn8BgCmUcgHg7ZLTHg.text: Finally made it here for the second time over the weekend!!  Went once during happy hour and liked it, went again for brunch and absolutely loved it.   Decor is fresh and relaxing. I like that it doesn't give you a feeling of being rushed, out server and host were friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.   We had crispy pig ear salad (I will order a double next time and enjoy it with a beer )   The truffle toad in the hole was a awesome breakfast item. Nice slab of brioche and truffle aroma   Shrimp ceviche with passion fruit aji was so refreshing our palates were definitely dancing.   I could go on but I think i painted a good picture of the place.   Thank you!!

JMgYJuJmM7HWCM5IN2SL2w.text: The best Rock Shrimp Tempura on the planet. Gotta try with their version of Pisco Sour

DVMd4sMgT_331_kujnNbUg.text: Service was quick and friendly. Started with the hamachi crudo - the soy sauce overpowered the dish, the fish was not trimmed well, there was still silver skin visible, unappetizing.  We then went to the heirloom tomato burrata, bland at first, after adding a little salt this dish became the star of the show (highly recommend) mozzarella was perfect, dish was balanced. Finished with the short ribs, overcooked which made it chewy with a forward charcoal ash flavor, sauce was way too sweet for me, the kimchi pickles were full of flavor and the best part of the dish could have used triple the amount to balance the sweet sauce. Plenty of options, i may give it another shot but lots to choose from around here and may run out of time.

h_aMV-X4hiLrVu7arlFMjw.text: Amazing.  Located in Restaurant Row in the Venetian, SUGARCANE simultaneously blends in while sticking out: you're usually on the way to somewhere else and might not be looking, but the clear and windowless view into the dining areas as well as the hostess stationed at the very front are unmistakable.   I was feeling the menu, so I stopped by SUGARCANE after a long day in Vegas. The hostess was very nice and sat me at a table next to the hallway, and I began to pore over the menu. There was just so much to consider and so many different permutations--tapas and a big plate? Maybe just a bunch of tapas? Had no idea.  Luckily, the waitress came along and I was able to ask her for recommendations. She also asked if I wanted some edamame, and of course I did! I didn't realize they would be $7, but I ended up really happy because they were supremely delicious--the spice on the outside with the roast from the grill and the squeeze of the lime was awesome if not slightly lip-burning.  Ultimately, I decided to get the pig ear pad thai along with the beef bone marrow. The pig ear pad thai was honestly not really much like a pad thai and was more of a papaya salad; its flavor was great, and the pig ears were nicely crisped to contrast with the pickled vegetables.   The beef bone marrow was huge and definitely could have fed two. The beef was incredibly rich and flavorful and almost overwhelming--in a good way. The bread was incredibly buttered and also rich, so in all I felt like the dish was almost bordering on too much. However, it tasted great, and I would just recommend to pace it with the greens on the dish as well as any other sides you have.  Overall, a truly great meal and tastes I will never forget. Would love to come back.

l09NN2lUr2RdBQR7yCoSgg.text: Excellent food. Great taste. Service was slow and not very good. Had to ask multiple times for coffee and syrup. And they never brought the extra syrup. Took a long time to get the check.   It also took a very long time for the wait staff to see how we were doing and bring additional items over.

zHYLeCtEl8OT1qHvmU0MMQ.text: We were originally going to go across the hall to Yardbird but after a couple of days of indulging (including a trip to the Bacchanal Buffet) we were in the mood for something light and delicious.  Thank goodness we chose Sugarcane. The tapas-like dishes were light and the flavors were fresh and bright. We ordered the lamb chops, seasonal mushrooms and hamachi over apples. The hamachi was probably one of our favorite dishes of the weekend, but the seasonal mushrooms were also a stand-out.   The drinks were also a hit. I LOVED my drink - Leche de Tigre (Pisco, coconut milk, yuzu, simple syrup and cilantro). My BF also really his Spice I'd Love (vodka, jalapeno, passion fruit, and mango).   All in all, it's the perfect place to stop for a bite if you need to take a break from the heavy indulgences.

Kxv0_7OtqSftknEpdEVnpA.text: Really looking forward to our first visit. Was really disappointed. Service was very slow and inattentive and waitress made lots of errors or at least someone did. We received the wrong ceviche and then we did not get the order of brussel sprouts. Then they tried to deliver some octopus which we didn't order. Providing such poor service while charging such high prices is unacceptable.  The very high priced small plates were all average nothing was special except the scallops. They were marvelous.  I am more than happy to pay high prices for average food if the service is impeccable. There are too many wonderful places in Vegas so you don't need to waste your money here.

JwJBHRYXlvEwLWrIUn3mVQ.text: Passing by this cute spot inside the Venetian restaurant row at 12am and their name and style caught my eye. It's a influential tapa/ small bites restaurant with full bar. Our waiter is super nice and everything we ordered came right up!  Food list: Bacon wrap date - the wrapped sausage is excellent! Edamame - loving their sea salt lemon flavor, must order! Kumamoto - we had a dozen and it was very fresh yet a bit bigger than usual and not very sweet. Sweet corn - who can say no? Strawberry cocktail - their signature and it was super strong and delicious Red cocktail - forgot the name but it was yummy and sweet!

WjxlhlH4mc1YuwHV3LNcLg.text: Located in Venetian/Palazzo Hotel. I was drawn by the Happy Hour sign! The host answered my questions and said Happy Hour is only offered at the bar.   They had amazing offerings such as their Raw Oysters! Everywhere you go in this town, everything is overpriced if you're used to the average prices in the South, so Happy Hour is heaven! Oysters in Vegas are never cheap. But here at Sugarcane, Happy Hour oysters are $1.50 each (6 min)! That's ok bc I was craving some oysters! I ordered half a dozen, my friends also ordered half a dozen, and then I paired them with Rosemary Fries ($6).  First impression: dimly lit back bar with modest dining area. Since it was an hour before happy hour ended, it wasn't that busy. Felt like the only 4 ppl there. Host seemed a little annoyed about me asking too many questions, so when she motioned me to sit at the bar, she didn't hand me any menus.   Service: We sit at the bar and then the bartender gives us both the happy hour and drink menus. They didn't seem thrilled about us ordering water and happy hour options. Initially, I wanted to go there to have a snack before dinner. I get it, it's a well-known place and we're sitting at a bar ordering water. Lighten up!   What was weird is that they didn't mention our oysters would be combined. So when they arrived, my friend who ordered with me changed seats so we can eat next to each other. We ended up sharing anyway. Oysters came with only cocktail sauce, so we asked for Tobasco sauce. Bartender was kind enough to offer horseradish too.   Food: Oysters were small but packed with flavor! It was chucked beautifully and tasted so fresh. They hit the spot. I only wished I had ordered a dozen for myself. Wish I knew what type of oyster they were. They're different from the usual large ones I get in FL. Rosemary Fries was a large portion topped with shredded cheese and fried rosemary, and I wasn't complaining! So good!  Overall: oysters were a steal! And the fries were so yummy! I'd go back for just the Happy Hour. They have other interesting options for $. From what I read on Yelp, the rest of the regular menu (including the oysters) is tripled the price.

jTRau0EuwUPYEuVMhvf28g.text: Decided to check out this place while in Vegas and let me tell you, you'll waste a TON of time here.   The food is decent enough, however the service leaves a lot to be desired.   We had to wait about 15mins between getting water and ordering our food, then the food took forever to get to us, we ordered a second Bloody Mary to have with brunch, but guess what.....it was served 15 mins AFTER we finished. Granted they took it off the bill, but come on the point is to have it with our food.   And had to wait still another 20 mins to get our check and another 20 to get my card back. It's just ridiculous how much we spent here.   They need to get much more staff to get people their food.

pZeBOH2XYOirFyo2vjEP5g.text: I must admit, we are in Vegas a lot, probably too much. We try just about every restaurant at out home away from, at Palazzo/Venetian. For whatever reason we have been skipping over Sugarcane and that was a mistake!  Why to go...music on the louder side which we liked, cool decor with open feel being right in the main walk way between the hotels, and the best part was the food!  The Dates stuffed with Spanish sausage wrapped in bacon were a nice twist on the typical version with cheese. I liked this version way more, especially since it was less dates which meant just the right amount of sweet. The Goat Croquettes went perfect with a nice glass of red wine. The Pig Ear Pad Thai dish was the closest flavors of Thailand since we were there, so good we got it twice, and the second one we asked to be extra spicy.   Sugarcane has made the cut, and is now in our rotation, too bad we waited so long.

photos.caption: Photo of SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dates, croquettes, and pig ear Thai dish. All were outstanding.

s-Ei9RWVtPLEV1X6waOGeA.text: Came in today with a group of friends. It was dead inside so we sat immediately. This will be a mostly negative review...  Cappuccino was decently flavored but lacked the decorative touch...  Shrimp ceviche oddly had no liquid, no citrus... Seemed quite fresh however so that's a plus..   The main negative was fat boy hash. Portion as small and honestly the entire dish tasted like it was doused in "truffle" flavor. The size is excusable because they brand themselves as "tapas" (at full meal prices), but that means the dish has to be on point. Today it was not.  I didn't taste the dates so cannot comment.  2 coffee drinks, wrapped dates, 2 breakfasts and ceviche fed 2 and came to $105 all included, we were better fed for half the price at Ramsay burger.

jOJ3ZZZGjq0rKIK8sHZCLw.text: This place is hands down some of the best food I have had anywhere - period!! It's simply amazing with creative , amazing dishes that are just delicious!  We went on a Monday and kinda early as we were feeling the effects of a 3am wake up to make the flight - so it was quiet but that also meant super attentive, fast service.  The dishes are mainly designed to be served tapas style with 2/3 dishes recommended per person so it's a great opportunity to explore the menu!  Some dishes were that good we had to repeat: Octopus was best I have ever had - cooked perfectly with a delicious lightly curried sauce , we also went with doubles of the scallop with compressed apple and a second go round of the ceviche with red snapper. It was seasonal with yams and corn ... and believe me it works!!   We also enjoyed shrimp, street corn which was delicious and the tuna tartare which the kids devoured!!  The food is just delicious, service impeccable, an amazing start to our vacation!

J11_V25H9MlqbuCJWWU7jA.text: I did a private event recently at Sugarcane so my review is based on that.  I have not eaten a regular meal there.  Overall our event went great.  The staff was very helpful and accommodating.  The contract and payment process went smoothly.  They wait weeks while I got the restaurant set up as a vendor in our system and then waited weeks more to get payments done.   For the event itself, we had the left side of the restaurant to ourselves with two bar areas and passed food.  I choose these appetizers below and everything was really tasty.  We had plenty to eat and drink.    1) salmon poke hijiki seaweed, sesame & soy - I even liked this and I don't normally like salmon or raw stuff. 2) skirt steak chimichurri - tasty steak, tender, yum! 3) avocado toast charred corn, whipped goat cheese - so good!  4) Japanese fried chicken sriracha aioli, scallions - I did not get to try this one but everyone liked it.  5) goat cheese croquettes, membrillo marmalade - so good as well!  So overall a great event.  Fun place, good food, very helpful staff.

ZBSnzmAPF6hmbhOsxAv6hQ.text: Why can't I give 10 stars? I guess I'll help 5 stars twice! This is amazing and I'm glad we found this place. This is gold. I want this every day.

3pkHC3iGgeG0Atoeyy-grw.text: Everything here was great! Our server was very attentive. I had the old fashioned.   My friend ordered the burrata salad & the pad Thai pig ear. Both portions were huge! The pig ear was quite tasty, nice & crispy.   I am coming back here for dinner when I'm in Vegas again! I really liked the service & the food.

Ynmayg3wSdAeCRhF3_CGYA.text: Everything is amazing here, soooo good.  My favorite was probably the bone marrow and the pad Thai.  Staff is also extremely friendly.

EOLhAQ97dlVbizyKJBJ5bA.text: Sugarcane is one of the best locations in restaurant row. Their tapas style dynamic makes sharing easy and accessible amongst a small or large group and their variety of dishes offered makes this place a must. The wagyu carpaccio, short ribs, brussel sprouts, and corn are must despite the fact their known for their east and west coast oysters.

f88TDG8-nnYZMxA2bu4tkg.text: Stopped by at around midnight for some great tapas and cocktails. You can tell they care about what they do. Cocktails used original ingredients and the service was excellent as well. Empanadas were outstanding and my beat mojito was tasty as well. Open late as well. Highly recommend.

bISf3uqi9Fjmh_JddQK1kg.text: Very unsatisfied with manager on duty. Staff seemed stressed by him and could over hear his foul language. Will not be back! Food was unpleasantly bland with a crunch of salt. Cheese croquettes saved the day.

selYSLytIMrHouCnYEffmA.text: My experience at SUGARCANE was very pleasant considering it was during a weekday and I was expecting a different atmosphere. We went for happy hour and weren't disappointed at all! Of all of their drinks my favorite was the Strawberry Balsamic because I'm not a heavy drinker when I dine out and it was a good blend of light/tart which went well with the small plates my group shared.  If you were to ask me what kind of food they serve though I honestly don't know what my answer would be because they have the most random assortment of dishes but everything that I tried was simply yummy. It wasn't too elegant that I felt my wallet hurt but wasn't so basic that I felt like I was overpaying; it hit the spot perfectly after a long day at work. If you're on the North-side of the Strip, I would definitely come back for their happy hour or maybe stop by for the Venetian Foodie Tour.  My highlight was that sweet corn because I love elote a lot-e.

rRSYqjQ1RTtQQRA43HNwgg.text: A new tapas/raw bar restaurant in the Venetian.  Nice clean modern design.  Laid back lounge bar feel.  I was in the mood for some raw fish so I went with the salmon poke and the bluefin tuna tartar.  Both were great.  Salmon poke had a mix of greens, crunchy toasted sesame seeds (?), and some nice pieces of salmon.  The tartar came served on a light, airey, crispy cracker.  Both dishes were both beautiful and delicious.  I would recommend this place for a quick eat and a drink.  On the pricier side but not too rediculous for the tapas.

62vCmp73gCp2_VEZBD583A.text: Amazing service and flavour. Manager came out to give us beignets since they had some misunderstanding in the kitchen w some of our orders. Cuban roast pork sandwich and pig ear pad thai were very flavorful!

Eo06x9vgSHnh7ntJm7-mcA.text: Great Tapas bar with an american flavor.   The Lobster rolls and sliders are a home run. The whole fish was very tasty and they have a gluten free menu for those type of folk!   Gets very busy so make your reservations

RGtW0EENehWOupZKv-GdpQ.text: 5 stars for service, 2 stars for food. Vegas locals and love trying all the new food spots. With a super promising menu, the food severely disappointed. Firefly wins everyday, and it's 1/2 the price.

GK_Jsoj9LzWBBfCt-mDHag.text: 4 1/2 Really, but well worth the trip.  The Miami location is better, but the Foie Gras and Duck Fried Rice is truly WOW FOOD.  Add a touch of soy and this is one of the most unique dishes out there, really exceptional, and I don't like fried rice !    The Sushi rolls were very good, but not all that memorable.

iJLXCzl8-WpfTjuZ9-2PvA.text: I love everything about this restaurant! I ate here everyday during my 5 day stay at The Venetian hotel in Vegas. I ordered the duck confit and waffle each time. The street corn is to die for! I just love the uniqueness of each dish. The staff here is super friendly and attentive. Thank you for outstanding hospitality and customer service. So happy there is now a location in NYC. I now get to enjoy one of my fave dishes as frequently as I want.

photos.caption: Photo of SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zHuafHow4m6CJsFtLRKJ1w.text: We were at the Palazzo Hotel to see the Rolling Stone exhibit. Timing could have been better because we were there during the CES convention. Boy was that hotel crowded. We wanted to grab a relatively quick breakfast before going into the exhibit. The line to get in to the Starbucks or the other coffee shop was at least 20 minutes long. And no seating in either one. Sugarcane was open despite the early morning hour. And lots of empty tables. Just a little hesitation on going into a place that calls itself a raw bar to eat breakfast ( which might explain the empty tables). But to my surprise they had a brunch menu that did not require eating anything Raw! And no wait for a table. We were seated immediately. And almost just as fast our server, Dean, appeared at the table to take our beverage order. My wife and I decided to share the toad in a hole and the avocado toast. The toad in a hole was a large piece of very thick bread with an over easy egg in the center. The bread was lightly toasted with melted cheese and honey on it. That was absolutely spectacular. The avocado toast was also quite good. An excellent choice for a fairly healthy light breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toad in a hole. Yummmm!
Photo of SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado toast

DLKJ7Mo4wV4i_T6aTXR7fA.text: Enjoyed a great meal here. Service was outstanding Jessica and Adrian made my experience special. Tuna tartare, pig ear pad Thai, and the lamb chops were wonderful. Very busy. Large bar and electric atmosphere makes this a great place for drinks and food with friends.

Ddqws_0ktQRjOPGDFKRoUQ.text: I think Yelp is broken. I can't give this business 6 stars?   Anyway.   There's a line between being an average bartender, a mixologist, and Jason.   As we thought beforehand that crafty drinks could not get any better, Jason blew our fucking minds.   Asking for a bartender's choice of drink/cocktail can be risky. They may make it not to your liking or it may just taste like... The kitchen sink.   We hinted "smoky, scotchy and not too sweet" yet one of our drinks came out with mezcal.   WE LOVE MEZCAL.   I'm sorry but when did bartending schools teach mind reading lectures??   Jason absolutely killed it with all the 'asks' we looked for.   Oh yeah, food was great too. Yet, as I told him, his drink concoctions were on another level.   And Jason, if you're reading this, the rum you rec'd me was something else. Holy sweet Jesus. That was a-fucking-mazing.   Yelp: don't flag this review for profanity. If you ate and drank what we had, you'd be verbally ecstatic too.

u9v_b2r5LVIU_fnFhHiBRg.text: Straight up crook waiter! The total was $59.44 so I put $80 in the fold and ask for change, so I can tip him. He brings me back 50 cents!! I called him back over right away and he swears up and down I only put $60 in there. WOW never in my life! I complained and did get $20 back the next with out even an apology from manager. Never again!!  The food was sub par, medicore. Not worth the money at all. $14 for some bland fried potatoes?

IFeFmljpJi6dL279hA0q_Q.text: Ordered beef empanada, very tasty.  Cuban sandwich was very good, perfect amount of everything, very filling.  Service was average.  Not a very busy day but slow service.  The place is in between Palazzo and the Venetian which is very convenient.

VOMFCBIe_UqEG8E2gm4kqA.text: We sat at the bar and were taken great care of by Danny. He made us the most delicious custom drinks. The food was very well executed and delicioso. Don't miss the mushrooms or the hamachi. We had excellent service and a great time!

zgfP94inGOGM4k3oZKzSKw.text: Absolutely five star rate. We came here for 2 nights in a row. They serve perfect drinks. To add flavor to the drinks, beef short ribs (Korean style) is the perfect combination. The sweet and salty taste makes you want to drink more and more. We have tried several drinks here. Strawberry balsamic which is kind of sour, but the fresh fruit taste still provides a nice taste. I personally like garden essence a lot, because the basil and black pepper provide a lavender taste. Spice of love is my friend's  favorite because it has mango and passion fruit taste in it. Tobacco Rum old fashioned and basil quencher are also worth trying.  For the beer, I recommend Delirium because it is 17 proof and has a nice alcohol taste. The servers have passion and are humorous as well. Definitely 5 star.

GRU3N0udRI-MU_L_IWv2UA.text: Don't you hate it when the baby mama wants to go shopping even when on vacation?!?  They are saying the opioid crisis is out of control in America, for generations woman and their shopping addiction has been the real disease and we have yet to find a cure; and it's draining our bank accounts exponentially!?!  All the shopping at the The Grand Canal Shoppes worked up an appetite, so enter SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill.  We came here looking to grab a small bite of Bone Marrow, but you know how that goes!?!  Come for the Bone Marrow but stay for everything else, cuz we obese Americans and we can't help ourselves.  This is what we chowed down on:  Report Card:  Kale and Apple Caesar Salad  A The baby mama loved it, I didn't even get to even try a bite so I guess I can say it was b o m b.  Sweet Corn B+ The flavor was on point but the corn had some super burned areas.  Tempura Rock Shrimp A+ Shrimp lovers, this is a must order!  Crispy Smashed Potato A- Cooked really well and the spicy mayo was a perfect pairing with the potatoes.  Bone Marrow B We came here for the bone marrow but it was a little two sweet, had a lot better elsewhere, also there was only one piece :(  The Venetian Hotel's most underrated restaurant in my opinion. Yes there's Yardbird and Chica but Sugarcane provides something a lil bit different and I like it, I like it a lot.  I can't wait to come back here and try more of their tapas items!

photos.caption: Photo of SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone Marrow
Photo of SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Smashed Potato
Photo of SUGARCANE Raw Bar Grill Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Rock Shrimp

iu2XizAdjAVXnDN1nVUhdg.text: Like tapas, most of their signature dishes are small but rich in flavor.  I've been here a couple of times and the food is consistently good.  On this occasion, we had kale & apple Caesar salad; tempura rock shrimp, beef short ribs; bone-in dry aged ribeye; and crispy smashed potatoes.  The star of the evening was the ribeye. It was cooked to perfection and full of flavor.  Unlike the other dishes, this was a 24oz cut and plenty to share for a party of 4.  The Caesar salad and  tempura rock shrimp were also amazing.  The salad had just enough dressing and the veggie and apple were fresh.  The batter on the tempura shrimp was light and flavorful.  The smashed potatoes are delicious.  Our least favorite dish was the short ribs.   Made Korean style, there wasn't a whole lot of meats to extract off the bone.  Flavor was good though.   Overall, this place is a solid 4 stars.  It is pricey but the atmosphere and food is great.  I highly recommend.

PVAF-7kSpc1_Z2xg31gxWA.text: Almost bookmark worthy, especially for happy hour.   A tapas style, open court/ dive bar eatery inside the Venetian,  sugarcane rawbar offers an array of sumptuous small plates to go with an equally great, rum- heavy cocktail selection.     Stand outs were the duck and waffle,  oysters,  and a very good happy hour wine selection to go with the small plates.  An impromptu dinner that surpassed my expectations.  Definitely return worthy.   4 to 5 stars.

_6iXvngsWd6VPzRaMPK3Rg.text: Another week, another wonderful dinner!:) The drinks were on point. Everyone followed my advise on my favorite cocktail, the strawberry basil. In fact later we had a similar drink at Smith & Wollensky and the one at sugarcane is just far better!! I had edamame and ceviche which were both excellent. The shrimp ceviche is sweet with the mango, really good.

_E9N1Cqo4AP4UgtJcX06eQ.text: Came here for a team lunch during our off-site meeting.  Everything was pre-ordered so I had no control of the dishes.  However, there wasn't anything that was served to us that wasn't good.  Our table devoured everything that was set in front of us.  We occupied three tables and I think everyone was loving every dish.   The food tasted fresh and served hot and delicious.  Since I have been on a low carbohydrate diet, I just tasted the dessert, but ate the protein dishes to my heart content.  I would come back and bring my wife to experience the various dishes and flavourful dishes on our next trip to Las Vegas.  That is my standard, if my experience is good enough to bring my wife back to experience.  This restaurant hit that high mark.

osAF9YcziQzvg8jB1iTWUw.text: What a hidden gem located in The Venetian Hotel. Stopped by here for Late Night  Happy Hour after eating at another restaurant. :( I'm a Foodie and The Foodie Diva is my name. :P  Food:  American Angus Slider Brussels Sprouts Pig Ear Pad Thai Delicious Old Fashion Drink  I loved every dish.  It had bursting flavors especially the pig ear pad thai. Yummy.  The old fashion was also one of the best I've ever had.    Overall, great dishes to choose from, lots of tables available to sit on and lastly, there's a DJ playing music that makes you want to dance. :)

UvZGciiq03GpFYljkVinFA.text: FOOD THAT IS PERFECTLY DONE!  We walked in for lunch and this place was packed. Luckily, there were seats at the bar so we decided to grab a few drinks and maybe wait for a table to become available. The bartenders were so entertaining that we ended up eating at the bar instead. We enjoyed the shrimp ceviche, raw oysters, steak & frites, and added a poke bowl because we were really hungry. Everything was flavorful and the food came out fast. We also enjoyed the drinks! Started off with regular mimosas and then our bartender suggested to try their other mimosa flavors and we ended up ordering more of the mango mimosa because we liked that the best.

I ordered the huevos rancheros - best I've had!! Eggs were perfect, they had some Chipotle aioli on it and it was yummy because i love sauce!!  Service was on point!  I need to come back to explore more menu items because everything looked amazing!!

But everything was tasting great with the right consistency of everything.   * Foie gras fried rice: had such an array of rich flavors. It was definitely something new I haven't had before.  * the salad was also really good.  Overall, food was great. 5 stars.  Service: We sat around waiting for someone to take our order for over 10mins. Later on, we couldn't even get someone to get us the check. Service was little to none.

lCVhqR60vYA6hLoS3DnApg.text: Another restaurant located in restaurant row between the Venetian and Palazzo we saw a Happy Hour advertisement outside and thought, hey let's try! Happy Hour is only served at the bar, fortunately there were 2 seats left and I grabbed them! They need to expand the seating for HH, as it's almost impossible for parties greater than 2 and I heard other people complaining about this. High top table seating near the bar should be available in complete fairness for groups to partake.   We ordered the oysters which were delicious, perfect brine and so creamy! Fresh and yummy and highly recommended. We shared the Parmesan  and garlic fries which were very satisfying along with roasted brussel sprouts that were made with fresh orange and sweet soy. So delicious too! We ordered the lobster rolls that were served with old bay spice and fresh dill. They tasted fresh and not overly mayonnaised like some can be. I highly recommend and can't wait to go back for more!  The bartender could have been a little more friendly and attentive. Perhaps because we didn't order a drink, but I can only drink so much alcohol in a day.  I still love good food any time of the day, and this place definitely serves that!! I can't wait to back!!!

vGZcRx47uqUA-aAWtDNDuA.text: I wasn't crazy about sugar cane. While the food was good, it just wasn't impressive. I was told that the food is small plates meant to share but they just came out as they were ready and it felt weird. I got the skirt steak with their  chimichurri with a side of their sweet corn. . . The corn was freaking amazing! Sweet corn, with a salty cheese, some paprika and then a half lime to squeeze over the top. So flavorful and fresh! . . The steak was good but i expected more. I thought the chimichurri was too heavy on the spice. I like spicy food, but this was all you tasted and it was off putting. It was cooked perfectly though. The meat itself was so tender and moist.  . . What i would go back for, was their drinks. I got the Rum N Bramble and i could drink those all day and never think twice. Flor De Cana 7 year rum,  yuzu, dry vermouth, blackberry puree and basil. Drink was AMAZING!!  . . Overall, good experience but with so many options in Vegas, sugarcane is one i don't think I'll return to for dinner, but will go back for happy hour before!

gOAwRNJgdPIkKvR9igxNtQ.text: Pleasantly surprised with their little gem. This spot was super crowded tonight as there's a Latin music awards happening in town. Asked the bartender if this was the norm for business and he stated that they had been slow all week up until tonight.  They have a cool HH from 4-7 where many of their appetizers are more than half off. Tried a lot quite a few of the apps including the Brussels sprouts, oysters, mini lobster roll, parmesan rosemary french fries. Everything we tried was solid and would order any of these items again.   The drinks were very reasonable as well, but we get those out on the floor while playing, so no need to fill up on those at the bar.   The HH is only available at the bar, so make sure to get there earlier rather than later, as the seats fill up very quickly.

AOko4bwU9hRvNYigzn_Jbw.text: Our waiter was fantastic. He was attentive, and very nice. He made sure we had everything we need. I got the waffles. They were amazing. Very light so I didn't feel overly bloated. The food was good but the service made it even better. I would defiantly recommend it anyone coming to Las Vegas!

Uk2wWK852vS87t6KIPfUpw.text: NOM NOM NOM!!! Came here on Sunday for brunch and everything was beyond delicious!   I came across this restaurant while searching for brunch spots and I am so glad I made it in. The food was amazing and the service was great. I am surprised it wasn't that busy ( maybe because it was easter sunday and people were buffeting it). I would for sure return!    Food: blue fin tuna tartare- YUMMMMM duck & waffle- best freakin thing ever! crispy smashed potato- good Side of Sausage and of course unlimited mimosas.

oCaU6XoEQDrWIvyyq_DFXA.text: Delicious! Came for happy hour and what a deal! Please try the pig ear phase Thai, croquettes, bacon wrapped dates, waffle and duck, and oysters. The slider was good but didn't stand out like all others mentioned. Surprisingly of all the dishes, pig ears was the best followed by the dates. Delicious strawberry balsamic drink, beet margarita, and old fashion. Had about 5 drinks and all those dishes along with 6 oysters at $1.50 each. Total bill was very adorable for the great food and quality. Definitely coming back and for happy hour.

UQfoTHBkTuLWnnKHyZMTYg.text: I came here for brunch with my mom and sister. The environment is friendly, and the staff was helpful and funny! The good was full of flavor, and the ingredients were fresh. The portions were slightly on the large side, but still manageable. Lastly, the coffee was a bit bitter and watered down. Overall, a great brunch joint.

-fm5xT4oB2v8s2Ok5t2LlQ.text: We're really want to try here and now we are.  Foods here it's so good but service very super slow for me. We're here and no water on the table like 5-10 min. And we're order foods all appetizers is coming and we finished it and we wait for main like more than 30+min until some staff coming and ask "everything is ok" and go back and check foods for us again. After that we waiting for 15+min more sooooo bad!! (Table around us already have foods and finished and pay bill but we still on appetizer).

yPKbAWq9q4R8xdt23ZFt_g.text: Came to dinner with family -- total of 6 people. We had reservations so that was helpful, it seemed like they were busy as the hotel/expo center was having a convention.  The food had good flavor, since this was tapas/small plates and meant for sharing, be prepared to order a few plates of each dish, although they say the plates are best for two people to share, depending on how hungry everyone is, you can probably get away with one plate for three people.  We had the grilled shrimp/toast, Korean short ribs, sweet potatoes, Brussels sprouts, edamame, grilled corn, and salad. I think our favorite was the short ribs and Brussels sprouts.  Dishes comes out as they are ready and beware, servers will clear plates pretty quickly, too... I was still eating bites of food and they took a plate from under me.

KQ1ryhYVmUqhiq-DoEqFkw.text: Pleasantly surprised by this little place on restaurant row in the Venetian.  Tapas style which means small plates and lots of stuff to share.  We ordered scallops, Shrimp Ceviche, Romaine Salad, Crab Cakes, and Pork Meatball Satay.  All was served quickly and with beautiful presentation.    The Scallops, Ceviche and the Romaine salad were standout good.  The Crab Cakes turned out to be Crab Cake (Singular) That's $14 bucks for one.  That was the only disappointment.  Everything else was great!  Highly recommend for a quick lunch to escape the Venetian conference food.
